title: Business & Finance
text:
Boeing is preparing to increase production of its 787 Dreamliner soon after the FAA allows deliveries to resume, according to a person close to the firm.

---

A surge in trading volumes in Berkshire's Class A shares last year was an illusion caused by a change in how Robinhood reports fractional trades, a study found.

---

Ford plans to cut several thousand white-collar jobs as it looks to trim costs to position the company for a long-range transition to electric vehicles.

---

Blackstone is in the final stages of raising a new real-estate fund that would set a record as the biggest vehicle of its kind.

---

Casinos in Macau will be allowed to reopen Saturday after a nearly two-week shutdown amid a Covid-19 outbreak.

---

U.S. stocks rose, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow advancing 0.6%, 1.6% and 0.2%, respectively.

---

United Airlines reported its first quarterly profit without the help of government aid since the start of the pandemic.

---

BlackRock is acquiring Vanguard Renewables, a company that coverts organic waste to fuel, in a deal valued at $700 million.
